.a: Static library file or Assembly source code
.agg: Heroes of Might and Magic 2 aggregate file
.air: Adobe AIR package or M.U.G.E.N. animation file
.aoe2campaign: Age of Empires II HD campaign file
.app: Generic application (mostly likely either Mac or Wii)
.ase: 3D Studio Max ASCII scene export data
.asf: Advanced Systems format or Electronic Arts music file
.bar: BANG! Engine data file or Brew MP application resource
.bcf: The Sims (2000, PC) Binary-encoded character mesh file
.bf: Ubisoft Jade Engine or Cryo archive file
.bln: Age of Empires II/Rise of Nations campaign media file
.blp: Blizzard texture or Blupi/Eggbert series game data file
.bmf: The Sims (2000, PC) Binary-encoded deformable mesh file
.bms: Be-Music Source file or QuickBMS script
.bone: World of Warcraft 3D model skeletal bone data
.bs6: Blake Stone: Aliens of Gold data file
.bsp: Binary Space Partitioning-based game map (i.e. idTech, GoldSrc, Genesis3D)
.caf: Core Audio file or CryEngine character animation
.cas: Frostbite general file or Total War model file
.cbl: Cobol source code or RSD Game Maker (DOS) character animation file
.cdr: CD raw data or CorelDraw drawing
.cel: Animation cell data or Cool Edit audio loop
.cga: Crytek Geometry animation file or computer graphics file
.chk: Starcraft game map or file fragment
.cmb: Legend of Zelda: OOT 3D model or Grand Theft Auto IV combat script
.cmd: CP/M executable or M.U.G.E.N. command/move definitions file
.cmo: Compiled mesh output file or 3DVIA Virtools behavioral script
.cmx: The Sims (2000, PC) ASCII-encoded character mesh file
.cob: Cobol source code or trueSpace 3D object
.con: Configuration file or Duke Nukem 3D script
.cp: C++ source code or Adobe Captivate source code
.cpk: Cinepak-compressed video or CriWare File Package
.cs: C# source file or Torque engine script
.db2: World of Warcraft client database file (newer)
.dbc: World of Warcraft client database file
.ddt: BANG! Engine texture or Jill of the Jungle music file
.dma: Renderware animation file or Jill of the Jungle file
.elf: Generic Unix Executable (Executable and Linkable Format)
.erb: Evil Genius Resource File or Ruby ERB script
.evt: Windows event log file or other event file
.flac: Free Lossless Audio Codec audio file
.fsh: OpenGL fragment shader or EA Sports image file
.gmd: Game Maker pre-version 6 (Mark Overmars) project file
.grf: Graphics resource file (i.e. Ragnarok, Rollercoaster Tycoon)
.h4r: Heroes of Might and Magic IV data file
.he0: Humongous Entertainment adventure game data file
.he2: Humongous Entertainment adventure game data file
.he4: Humongous Entertainment adventure game data file
.hmp: Human Machine Interfaces MIDI or Worms 3D/4 height map
.hot: The Sims (2000, PC) sound logic file
.ima: Disk Image File or unspecified (graphical) image
.ipl: Grand Theft Auto III/Vice City item placement binary file
.jsp: RenderWare model file or Jamul sprite file
.key: Bioware Infinity game resource file or unspecified key file
.kwd: KWord document or Dungeon Keeper 2 level layout
.lod: Heroes of Might and Magic III data file
.lsd: RPG Maker engine game save file
.m: Objective-C source file or Re-Volt world file
.m2: Blizzard 3D model file or Modula-2 source file
.mbl: RSD Game Maker (DOS) monster animation file
.mcd: 'X-COM: UFO Defense/UFO: Enemy Unknown' map control data
.md5: MD5 checksum file or Doom 3 model
.miz: DCS World mission file or WinAmp compressed MIDI
.mls: Miles Sound System compressed DLS data
.mss: Miles Sound System DLS 1 and XMI data
.mx2: Heroes of Might and Magic II expansion map file
.oaf: Obsidian archive or Flight Simulator texture
.opt: Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance flight model or unspecified options file
.ovl: Program overlay or Frontier Developments model file
.pig: Descent 2 or Pirates of the Burning Sea resource file
.pix: Alias PIX image file or BRender raster image file
.pnt: MacPaint image or Panther toolkit project file
.prs: Sega (Saturn) or Presage Software compressed file
.qrc: Qt Resource container or Daggerfall quest resource file
.qst: Phantasy Star Online quest resource file
.r: Source code file (i.e. Apple Rez, R)
.rda: BlueByte Anno/Dawn of Discovery data archive
.rez: LithTech engine data or Escape Velocity: Nova plug-in file
.rgba: Silicon Graphics Image (3 color channels + alpha)
.rga: Relic Entertainment Game Model animation (i.e. Company of Heroes)
.rgd: Relic Entertainment Game Data (i.e. Company of Heroes)
.rgm: Relic Entertainment Game Model (i.e. Company of Heroes)
.rgss3a: RPG Maker VX Ace Encrypted archive
.rgt: Relic Entertainment Game Texture (i.e. Company of Heroes)
.rlb: Tsunami Games engine resource bank file
.rmp: 'X-COM: UFO Defense/UFO: Enemy Unknown' AI map routing data
.rpf: Rockstar packaged file or LEGO MindStorm EV3 program file
.rpgmvm: RPG Maker VX encrypted M4A file
.rpgmvo: RPG Maker VX encrypted Ogg Vorbis file
.rpgmvp: RPG Maker VX encrypted PNG file
.sbx: ScratchX project or GLBasic shoebox file
.sc4: SimCity 4 or RollerCoaster Tycoon scenario file
.scc: SourceSafe control file or Stepmania dancebeat file
.scm: Starcraft map file or Scheme source code
.sdc: Secure Download Cabinet or OpenOffice Calc spreadsheet
.sitx: Stuff-It Expander Archive (Mac OS X version)
.skn: The Sims (2000, PC) ASCII-encoded deformable mesh file
.sm: Smalltalk source file or Stepmania dancebeat file (legacy)
.smd: Valve 3D model (old) or Genesis/Mega Drive ROM
.sol: Flash local shared object or Sierra Audio file
.sou: SCUMM Engine sound file or Nintendo 3D model data file
.spe: Spiderpaint image or Genewars (game) speech file
.spk: 'X-COM: UFO Defense/UFO: Enemy Unknown' background image
.sst: Children of the Nile texture file
.st: Starship Titanic asset archive or Atari ST disk image
.stl: Stereolithography 3D printing file or SuperTux level file
.tap: Tap Tap Revenge music file or Cassette tape copy
.tbv: 3-D Ultra/Return of the Incredible Machine data file
.tdb: Transcendence file database or Android thumbnail cache
.tex: TeX formatted document or unspecified texture file
.tfr: Star Wars: TIE Fighter save file
.tmd: PlayStation 3D model or Nintendo 3DS title metadata
.toml: Tom's Obvious, Minimal Language source code
.tre: Hierarchical (data tree) file archive (i.e. Electronic Arts games)
.ult: Ultima III data file or Ultima IV town file
.usda: Pixar Universal Scene Description ASCII-encoded file
.usdz: Pixar Universal Scene Description zipped file
.usm: SWAT 4 static mesh or Video game movie file (unknown program)
.viv: Electronic Arts archive or unspecified video file
.vmc: Area 51 (Windows, 1996) graphics file or Virtual Machine configuration file
.vmd: Sierra movie data or Vocaloid motion data
.vox: Voxlap voxel model file or Dialogic ADPCM (VOX) file
.vsi: Blake Stone: Planet Strike data file
.wip: Mordor: The Depths of Dejenol data file
.wlw: World of Warcraft water level map
.world: World file (i.e. Terraria, Sims series, StarBound)
.wpl: Grand Theft Auto San Andreas/IV item placement binary file
.wtd: Grand Theft Auto IV texture mapping file
.xld: Albion (Blue Byte) data file or ancient Excel file
.xmf: Extensible Music file or Cal3D XML mesh
.xscene: Mount & Blade II scene object file
.z: Unix archive file or Marathon 2 data file
